title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એવી લીલા અલબેલે કીધી, પછી સંતને શીખ જ દીધી; 
કહે નાથ સુણો સહુ જન<RHYME_212300>, તમે રહેજ્યો મનમાં મગન<RHYME_212300>.
gujarati.context: A playful game was played, and then the lesson was taught to the wise one. Later, Nath said to his friend, "You will remain forever in my heart, like a magnet."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
વળી કરશું ઉત્સવ અમે, મળી આવજ્યો મુનિયો તમે; 
જાઓ ફરો કરો હરિવાત<RHYME_212302>, રહેજ્યો રાજી તમે રળિયાત<RHYME_212302>.
gujarati.context: We celebrate the festival of life, you join with glee; Leave worries behind, and let your soul be set free.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ઘણા ઘણા ઉત્સવ કરીને, દઈશ સુખ હું ફરી ફરીને; 
અતિ તમને લડાવવા લાડ<RHYME_212304>, મારા મનમાં છે ઘણી ચાડ<RHYME_212304>.
gujarati.context: I enjoy many celebrations and happiness keeps recurring; You may try to fight me, but I have a lot of teasing stored in my mind.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કરું તમને પૂરણકામ<RHYME_212305>, એમ બોલિયા સુંદરશ્યામ<RHYME_212305>; 
સંત સાંભળી વાલાની વાણી, ચાલ્યા આનંદ ઉરમાં આણી.
gujarati.context: I will complete your work to the best of my ability, just like the beautiful Sundaram said; Listen to the saint's words, and take joy in the world.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કૈક ગયા છે ગુજરદેશ<RHYME_212307>, કૈકે કર્યો કચ્છે પ્રવેશ<RHYME_212307>; 
વાગડ સોરઠ વાલાકે વળી, ગઈ મારુદેશમાં મંડળી.
gujarati.context: Some have gone to Gujarat, done their duty in Kutch; and I too will go, forming a gathering in my own land.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કૈક પોત્યા છે પૂરવ માંય<RHYME_212309>, કરવા વાત પ્રભુજીની ત્યાંય<RHYME_212309>; 
એમ સર્વે દેશે સંત ગયા, જેને રાખ્યા તે પાસળે રહ્યા.
gujarati.context: The Lord's will is the only thing that matters, and it's fulfilled everywhere. Those who remain in His shelter remain safe forever.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ આનંદમાં સહુ સંત<RHYME_212311>, કરે લીલાની વાતો અત્યંત<RHYME_212311>; 
ચિંતવે નિત્ય ચરિત્ર ચિત્તે, કરે પરસ્પર વાતો પ્રીતે.
gujarati.context: In joy and happiness, one should talk sweet nothings; daily reflecting on character, converse lovingly with others.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
તેણે આનંદ અંગે ન માય<RHYME_212313>, રાત્ય દિવસ રાજીપે જાય<RHYME_212313>; 
કરે વાત પ્રભુની વિસ્તારી, સુણે પરસ્પર નરનારી.
gujarati.context: The couplet says that true joy is not found in worldly pleasures, but rather in the morning and evening moments of spiritual connection with God. Through devotion, one's soul connects with another's, transcending material desires.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સાચી વાત શ્રવણે સાંભળી, થાય સત્સંગી કુસંગી ટળી; 
આપે જ્ઞાનદાન એમ સંત<RHYME_212311>, ફરે જગતમાં તારવા જંત<RHYME_212311>.
gujarati.context: Honest words should be listened to and followed, for they can bring people together; a saintly person shares knowledge as a gift, so that it may reach the world.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
જિયાં જિયાં મુનિજન ફરે, તિયાં પૃથ્વી પાવન કરે; 
એવા સંત જન સુખકારી, અતિ પવિત્ર પરઉપકારી.
gujarati.context: The gods wander, while the earth bestows its blessings; similarly, a saintly person brings joy and spiritual benefit to others.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
જેને એક હરિની છે આશ, સર્વે જક્તથી રહે છે ઉદાસ; 
જેને પૂરણબ્રહ્મશું પ્રીત<RHYME_212318>, અન્ય વસ્તુ ન ચિંતવે ચિત્ત<RHYME_212318>.
gujarati.context: One who has devotion to the Lord (Hari) has a sense of longing, and their mind remains focused on Him; one who has love for the ultimate truth (Brahman) does not worry about anything else.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એવા સંત સહુ શિરોમણિ, કહીયે મોટપ્ય શું એની ઘણી; 
પરમારથ અર્થે છે ફરવું, વચ્ચે જીવનું કલ્યાણ કરવું.
gujarati.context: A saintly person's greatest achievement is not in speaking much, but rather in walking the middle path and bringing about overall well-being in life.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સુખદાયક સહુ જનના, અતિ ઉદાર મોટા મનના; 
એવા સંત અત્યંત ઉદાર<RHYME_212321>, તેણે કર્યો છે એમ વિચાર<RHYME_212321>.
gujarati.context: A kind and generous person is a pleasure to be around, with a big heart that does good deeds. Such a saintly person is extremely charitable, thinking only of others' well-being.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
વરતી વસંતઋતુ રૂપાળી, આવ્યાં વન નાવ્યા વનમાળી; 
આવ્યા અંબ કદંબ અપાર<RHYME_212323>, કેશુ કેશરનો નહિ પાર<RHYME_212323>.
gujarati.context: The spring season arrives with beauty and vitality, bringing lush greenery and fragrance; just like the mighty Ambika tree that knows no bounds or limits.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યાં ચંપા ચમેલીએ ફૂલ<RHYME_212324>, ફૂલ્યા ગુલાબ ગેહેરા અમૂલ<RHYME_212324>; 
ફૂલી સુંદર ફૂલે સેવતી, બીજાં વનવેલી ફૂલી અતિ.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Beautiful flowers bloom, and like roses, they are beyond compare; their beauty serves as a lesson to others, too.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યાં તરુ તે ભાર અઢાર<RHYME_212325>, કેમ નાવિયા ધર્મકુમાર<RHYME_212325>; 
એમ કહિને થયા ઉદાસ<RHYME_212326>, અતિ દલે દલગીર દાસ<RHYME_212326>.
gujarati.context: The burden of the past weighs heavily on the soul, just like a debt of Dharmakumar (Lord Krishna). In despair, one becomes enslaved to their own troubles.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કોઇ ગદ્‍ગદ વાણીએ બોલે, કોઈ આતુર અંતરે ડોલે; 
કોઈને આવ્યાં નયણે નીર<RHYME_212328>, સહુ અંતરે પામ્યા અધીર<RHYME_212328>.
gujarati.context: Someone's words may be loud and harsh, but another person's inner self may be delicate and easily hurt. Someone's kindness may not reach you, but your own heartache will meet its equal in sorrow.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
જળ વિના જેમ અકળાય મીન<RHYME_212329>, સ્વાંત વિના જેમ ચાતક દીન<RHYME_212329>; 
મેઘ વિના જેમ અકળાય મોર<RHYME_212330>, ચંદ્ર વિના અકળાય ચકોર<RHYME_212330>.
gujarati.context: Without a vessel, the sea cannot be calmed; without oneself, one's own life cannot be governed. Without clouds, the sky cannot be shaded; without moonlight, night's darkness cannot be dispelled.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ અતિ અકળાણા જન<RHYME_212300>, પછી કરવા બેઠા ભજન<RHYME_212300>; 
ધારી મૂરતિ અંતર માંય<RHYME_212309>, જપે નારાયણને જિભાય<RHYME_212309>.
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet says that when we are deeply engaged in worldly pursuits, we should pause and offer prayers to God, just as one would take a deep breath within the inner recesses of their heart.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ બેઠાં છે ઘડી બે ચાર<RHYME_212331>, થયાં શુકન શુભ તે વાર<RHYME_212331>; 
કેની ભુજા ફરકી જમણી, કેની ફરકી આંખ્ય નમણી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Life's journey unfolds in ups and downs, with both good and bad days. Just as we adjust our gaze to see things clearly, so too should we navigate life's twists and turns with discernment.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કેની ફરકી છે પગની પેની, કહે પરસ્પર વાત તેની; 
કરતાં વાત તે શુકન તણી, આવી ત્યાં વાલાની વધામણી.
gujarati.context: The couplet is about the superficial conversations people have with each other, where they only discuss trivial matters without genuinely connecting.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કહે અમે ગઢડેથી આવ્યા, સર્વે મુનિને તિયાં તેડાવ્યા; 
એવું સંત શ્રવણે સાંભળી, ચાલી ગામોગામથી મંડળી.
gujarati.context: We have come from the mountains, and have told all saints to wait; such a saint listened, and then went back to his own village.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યા સંત પ્રભુજીને પાસ, આપે ઊઠી મળ્યા અવિનાશ; 
અતિ હેતે હસીને બોલાવ્યા, કહે નાથ સંત ભલે આવ્યા.
gujarati.context: The Lord's devotee has arrived, and with them, eternal bliss; they have laughed away all troubles and now reside in peace. The Lord has called out to them, saying that even the greatest saints like them are welcome.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
આજ ક્યાં થકી આવિયા ચાલી, કરો ભિક્ષા કહે કર ઝાલી; 
સુંદર રસોઈ કરી છે સારી, શાક પાક તાજાં છે તયારી.
gujarati.context: Today's journey has brought us to this place, where we beg for alms and walk with a gait; the beautiful feast is prepared well, the fresh vegetables are ripe and ready.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બેઠી સંતની પંગતિ, આપે પીરસે આનંદે અતિ; 
નિત્ય નવી રસોયો કરાવે, જોરે જોરે જમાડી હરાવે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a saint's nature as being joyful and full of delight, spreading happiness to others daily with new discoveries and inspirations.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ આનંદમાં અલબેલો, દિયે છાકમછોળ છબીલો; 
ના ના કરતાં ભરી દિયે ભાણું, એ સમાની શોભા શું વખાણું.
gujarati.context: In moments of great joy, even the most mundane things seem beautiful; I will praise its beauty and magnificence, but only when it's deserving of such acclaim.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
શીશે શોભે છે સોનેરી રેંટો, કેડ્યે કશ્યો છે કસુંબી ફેંટો; 
પહેરી સુથણી સુંદર શોભે, જોઈ નાડી રૂડી મન લોભે.
gujarati.context: The beauty of golden youth is fleeting, just like the fragility of a lotus flower. But in the present moment, one's lovely appearance can captivate the mind and fill it with longing.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ગળે પહેર્યા ગુલાબના હાર<RHYME_212323>, તોરા લેકે ને બેકે અપાર<RHYME_212323>; 
કોટે શોભે કનકની માળા, કરમાં કનક કડાં રૂપાળાં.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a person who has been adorned with love, just like a rose is made beautiful by its thorns; their beauty is enhanced by the intricacies of their relationships.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
હાથે મુદ્રિકા માંય છે મણિ, તેની ઝગમગે જોત્ય ઘણી; 
કરે લટકાં ને લાડવા હાથ<RHYME_212342>, જમે જન જમાડે છે નાથ<RHYME_212342>.
gujarati.context: The couplet is about the power of a gentle touch, likening it to a precious jewel that sparkles brightly; with just a few strokes, one can bring joy to others and fill their hearts with happiness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
વળી કરે અલૌકિક વાત<RHYME_212302>, સુણી સંત થાય રળિયાત<RHYME_212302>; 
એમ વીતી ગયા દશ દિન<RHYME_212343>, આવ્યા બોટાદના હરિજન<RHYME_212300>.
gujarati.context: The divine is revealed through extraordinary events, and the humble become saints; after a period of ten days, the untouchables became worthy of worship.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
આવી લાગ્યા પ્રભુજીને પાય<RHYME_212309>, અતિ હરષે ભર્યા મન માંય<RHYME_212309>; 
કહે આવીયે અમારે ગામ<RHYME_212344>, હરિ પૂરીએ સહુની હામ<RHYME_212344>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The Lord's feet have reached us, filling our minds with immense joy; we are saying that our village has come to visit, and God has fulfilled our family's desire.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સર્વે જોઈ રહ્યા જન વાટ<RHYME_212345>, વાલા તમારાં દર્શન માટ<RHYME_212345>; 
સર્વે સંત સહિત પધારો, હરિજનને હર્ષ વધારો.
gujarati.context: All are seeking the sight of your feet; with every step, you should bring joy to the lowly and uplift them.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સર્વે કરી મૂક્યો છે સમાજ<RHYME_212347>, તમારે પ્રતાપે મહારાજ<RHYME_212347>; 
એવું સુણી રાજી હરિ થયા, સારું આવશું અમે સહુ તિયાં.
gujarati.context: The society is controlled by a few powerful individuals, while you are like a great king to me; but I will still obey you with a happy heart and patiently wait for the right moment.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી શ્યામળિયો સજ્જ થઈ<RHYME_212348>, ચાલ્યા સંગે સખા સંત લઈ<RHYME_212348>; 
શોભે શ્રીહરિ ઘોડાની ઘટે, આવી ઊતર્યા તળાવ તટે.
gujarati.context: When the time comes, Shyamali is ready, and with friends and saints, they depart; Lord Srihari's glory is reflected in the waves of the lake as they arrive at its shore.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
દેશદેશના આવ્યાતા દાસ<RHYME_212326>, તે પણ ઊતરિયા આસપાસ<RHYME_212326>; 
પછી ઊઠિયા દીનદયાળ<RHYME_212350>, સર્વે સંઘની લેવા સંભાળ<RHYME_212350>.
gujarati.context: Foreigners may come and go, but we stay rooted here; after settling down, we take care of all our community's needs.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ફર્યા ઉતારે ઉતારે નાથ<RHYME_212342>, કહે સુખિયા છો સહુ સાથ<RHYME_212342>; 
કાંઈ જોઈએ તે મંગાવી લેજ્યો, ખરચી નોય તો અમને કહેજ્યો.
gujarati.context: Life's journey goes on, whether you're happy or not; Don't waste your time worrying about what's coming, just enjoy the present with others.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ પૂછિયું સહુ દાસને, પછી અલબેલો આવ્યા આસને; 
ગાડા ઉપર ઢોલિયો ઢાળી, તિયાં પોઢ્યા પોતે વનમાળી.
gujarati.context: I asked the slave for something, and then an unexpected guest arrived at my doorstep; he sat on the chariot, beating the drums, while I played the flute myself.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સતસંગી ને સર્વે સંત<RHYME_212311>, રહ્યા રાત્ય ભેળા ભગવંત<RHYME_212311>; 
અતિ આનંદમાં ગઈ રેણ<RHYME_212353>, પછી જાગિયા કમળનેણ<RHYME_212353>.
gujarati.context: In the company of good people, one finds godliness everywhere; however, excessive joy can lead to a delayed sense of sorrow.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
તર્ત મગાવ્યો વાજિ તે વાર<RHYME_212331>, તે પર નાથ થયા અસવાર<RHYME_212331>; 
જોઈ સીમ ને વાડી સઘળી, પછી નાહીને આવિયા વળી.
gujarati.context: A person's reputation is ruined when they take credit for something that belongs to others, and as a result, their honor is lost. When one crosses the limit of what's proper, there will be consequences afterwards.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
આવી ગામમાં દર્શન દીધાં, સર્વે જન કૃતારથ કીધાં; 
પછી સુંદર કરી રસોઈ<RHYME_212355>, જમ્યા નાથ જનભાવ જોઈ<RHYME_212355>.
gujarati.context: In a village, I saw everyone's faces filled with joy; after that, the beauty of their company was relished.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી જમાડિયા સર્વે સંત<RHYME_212311>, કરી મનવાર્ય આપે અત્યંત<RHYME_212311>; 
પછી પધારિયા પુરબાર્ય<RHYME_212356>, આવ્યાં દર્શને સહુ નરનાર્ય<RHYME_212356>.
gujarati.context: After a great loss, one becomes extremely devoted to God; after finding a worthy guide, one's journey becomes divine.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ આનંદમાં વીત્યો દન<RHYME_212357>, કરી આરતી જમ્યા જીવન<RHYME_212357>; 
પછી ગવૈયે ગાવણું લીધું, ગાઈ જીવત સુફળ કીધું.
gujarati.context: In eternal bliss, one's soul is spent, and life's journey comes to an end; afterwards, the fruits of life are gathered in and its success is achieved.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
બહુ વાર દીધાં દરશન<RHYME_212357>, પછી ગામમાં આવ્યા જીવન<RHYME_212357>; 
તિયાં પોઢિયા પ્રાણ આધાર<RHYME_212359>, સુખ આનંદે થયું સવાર<RHYME_212359>.
gujarati.context: After seeing a lot of sufferings, I returned to my village and found life; My existence is rooted in the joy and happiness of being alive.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી ઘોડે ચડ્યા ગિરિધારી, આવ્યા સંઘ માંહિ સુખકારી; 
પછી સર્વે જન લઈ સાથ<RHYME_212342>, આવ્યા ગામ માંહિ પોતે નાથ<RHYME_212342>.
gujarati.context: After riding the horse Giridhari, they came to the sangh with joy; then all people took them along, and they went back to their village without a care.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
શહેર બજારે સંત ન માય<RHYME_212313>, ઊડે ગુલાલ હોળી રમાય<RHYME_212313>; 
વાજે ઢોલ દદામા શરણાઈ<RHYME_212360>, જય શબ્દે રહ્યો નભ છાઈ<RHYME_212360>.
gujarati.context: The city's noise and chaos are not my home, I playfully dance in the colorful festival; My heart beats with joy when the drum sounds, my soul is set free by the rhythm.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ રંગે રમ્યા હરિ હોળી, સંગે લઈ મુનિજન ટોળી; 
પછી નાહીને આવિયા નાથ<RHYME_212342>, આવ્યા સર્વે સંતજન સાથ<RHYME_212342>.
gujarati.context: God had a grand celebration with Hari and the saints, accompanied by music and dance. Later, they all arrived without exception, united in their devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
આવી કર્યાં પ્રભુએ ભોજન<RHYME_212300>, પછી જમાડિયા સર્વે જન; 
ત્યાંથી આવિયા દરબાર માંય<RHYME_212309>, હતો મંડપ ચોતરો ત્યાંય<RHYME_212309>.
gujarati.context: God has given us food and shelter, after which we should be content with everything; there, in that royal court of ours, there was a beautiful courtyard within.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં બેઠા રાજા અધિરાજ<RHYME_212362>, આવ્યા મલ્લ ત્યાં રમવા કાજ<RHYME_212362>; 
રમી મલ્લ ને મજરો કીધો, આપી રૂપૈયા શિરપાવ દીધો.
gujarati.context: The king was seated at the throne, while the wrestler came to play; He wrestled with Mall and won, proudly raising his hand in victory.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સંતને તેડાવ્યા નાથે, આપ્યાં પ્રસાદી મોદક હાથે; 
પછી સંતને શીખ જ દીધી, એવી લીલા બોટાદમાં કીધી.
gujarati.context: After the saint's departure, one receives blessings in one's hand; the saint had taught only the basics, just like a gentle rain that quenches thirst.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
લીધો લાવો અલૌકિક જને, ફાગણ સુદિ પૂન્યમને દને; 
તે દિ ઉત્સવ કર્યો મહારાજે, સંતને સુખ આપવા કાજે.
gujarati.context: The divine was pleased with the righteous person, who had celebrated the festival of Poonam with great joy and prosperity. This was done by the king himself to bring happiness to the saint.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સોમલો ભક્ત વળી હમીર<RHYME_212366>, ભગા હીરા ભગત સુધીર<RHYME_212366>; 
એહ આદિ હરિજન જેહ<RHYME_212367>, તેણે કરાવ્યો ઉત્સવ તેહ<RHYME_212367>.
gujarati.context: The devoted soul is filled with divine love and longing, reaching the limits of devotion to God; this Adi Harijan has organized a grand festival in the name of His Lordship.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 81: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāje Boṭādmā Fūladolno Utsav Karyo

transliteration.couplet:
Evī līlā Alabele kīdhī, pachhī santne shīkh ja dīdhī; <RHYME_1>
Kahe Nāth suṇo sahu jan, tame rahejyo manmā magan.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: In this couplet, the speaker describes a person who has found spiritual peace and is no longer bothered by worldly worries. They are advised to cherish this state of inner calm and not let it slip away again.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī karashu utsav ame, maḷī āvajyo muniyo tame; <RHYME_2>
Jāo faro karo harivāt, rahejyo rājī tame raḷiyāt.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The celebration of life is in full bloom, and wise sages are gathered around; go forward with humility, and remain serene within.

transliteration.couplet:
Ghaṇā ghaṇā utsav karīne, daīsh sukh hu farī farīne; <RHYME_3>
Ati tamane laḍāvavā lāḍ, mārā manmā chhe ghaṇī chāḍ.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context:
The festival will be joyous and festive, with happiness overflowing; the pain of past sorrows will be forgotten like a spent thread.

In this couplet, the speaker expresses hope for a happy celebration (utsav) where all troubles (daīsh) are left behind, and memories of past pain (mārā manmā) are forgotten.

transliteration.couplet:
Karu tamane pūraṇkām, em boliyā sundar-shyām; <RHYME_4>
Sant sāmbhaḷī vālānī vāṇī, chālyā ānand urmā āṇī.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a beautiful and melodious speech that is like a pure drink, quenching the thirst of one's soul. It is a sweet and harmonious language that brings joy and happiness to those who listen.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaik gayā chhe Gujardesh, kaike karyo Kachchhe pravesh; <RHYME_5>
Vāgaḍ Soraṭh Vālāke vaḷī, gaī Mārudeshmā manḍaḷī.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: Gujarat's gates are open, and the Kutch region welcomes all; in Vagaad Soraath, there is a vast expanse to roam free.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaik potyā chhe pūrav māy, karavā vāt Prabhujīnī tyāy; <RHYME_6>
Em sarve deshe sant gayā, jene rākhyā te pāsaḷe rahyā.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: In the presence of the Lord, even the wind is still, and the entire universe has become peaceful. Everywhere, peace has settled like a treasure in every home.

transliteration.couplet:
Em ānandmā sahu sant, kare līlānī vāto atyant; <RHYME_7>
Chintave nitya charitra chitte, kare paraspar vāto prīte.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: A joyful saint, extremely playful, is a wonderful thing. Their daily character is without worry, and they lovingly share with others.

transliteration.couplet:
Teṇe ānand ange na māy, rātya divas rājīpe jāy; <RHYME_8>
Kare vāt Prabhunī vistārī, suṇe paraspar nar-nārī.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: When one finds happiness in the self, they become royalty at night; their words spread far and wide like the wind under the guidance of God.

transliteration.couplet:
Sāchī vāt shravaṇe sāmbhaḷī, thāy satsangī kusangī ṭaḷī; <RHYME_9>
Āpe gnāndān em sant, fare jagatmā tāravā jant.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: A truthful listener is a precious treasure, and a pure-hearted friend is like a beautiful gem. The wise soul within me is the ruler of the world, and my heart is a sacred temple.

transliteration.couplet:
Jiyā jiyā munijan fare, tiyā pṛuthvī pāvan kare; <RHYME_10>
Evā sant jan sukhkārī, ati pavitra par-upakārī.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises two types of people: those who take joy in their own happiness and those who bring spiritual peace to others; both are considered sacred and bring great benefit.

transliteration.couplet:
Jene ek Harinī chhe āsh, sarve jaktathī rahe chhe udās; <RHYME_11>
Jene pūraṇbrahmashu prīt, anya vastu na chintave chitta.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context:
The speaker is grateful for a peaceful existence where all worries are left behind; they have no attachment to worldly things, having found contentment in the divine.

Their mind is at peace, free from all concerns and focused on pleasing the ultimate truth.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā sant sahu shiromaṇi, kahīye moṭapya shu enī ghaṇī; <RHYME_12>
Paramārath arthe chhe faravu, vachche jīvnu kalyāṇ karavu.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: This couplet emphasizes the importance of spiritual growth (Evā sant) and urges one to strive for a higher purpose in life (Paramārath arthe chhe faravu).

transliteration.couplet:
Sukhdāyak sahu jannā, ati udār moṭā mannā; <RHYME_13>
Evā sant atyant udār, teṇe karyo chhe em vichār.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: The summary is: A great person has a noble mind and a wide vision, and their good deeds are the result of deep thought.

transliteration.couplet:
Varatī Vasanta ṛutu rūpāḷī, āvyā van nāvyā Vanmāḷī; <RHYME_14>
Āvyā amb kadamb apār, keshu kesharno nahi pār.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: The spring season arrives in a beautiful form, and the forest's beauty is newly found. The river's banks are filled with kadamba flowers, and even the hair of the trees seems to have grown beyond reach.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā champā chamelīe fūl, fūlyā gulāb geherā amūl; <RHYME_15>
Fūlī sundar fūle sevatī, bījā vanvelī fūlī ati.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The beauty of the tulip is praised for its delicate petals and fragrance, rivaling the scent of a rose. The tulip's seeds are said to grow in the same field where it blooms.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā taru te bhār aḍhār, kem nāviyā Dharma-kumār; <RHYME_16>
Em kahine thayā udās, ati dale dalagīr dās.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the self-sacrificing nature of a righteous person (Dharma-kumār), who bears the weight of others' troubles like a tree bears fruits. Their path is one of devotion, not seeking personal gain or praise.

transliteration.couplet:
Koi gadgad vāṇīe bole, koī ātur antare ḍole; <RHYME_17>
Koīne āvyā nayaṇe nīr, sahu antare pāmyā adhīr.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: Someone speaks with a sweet tongue, while someone else stirs up trouble in their heart. Someone's path is guided by wisdom, while another's is stuck in the darkness of attachment.

transliteration.couplet:
Jaḷ vinā jem akaḷāy mīn, swānt vinā jem chātak dīn; <RHYME_18>
Megh vinā jem akaḷāya mor, chandra vinā akaḷāya chakor.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: Life without love is like a fish out of water, and joy without self-awareness is like an empty day.

transliteration.couplet:
Em ati akaḷāṇā jan, pachhī karavā beṭhā bhajan; <RHYME_19>
Dhārī mūrati antar māy, jape Nārāyaṇne jibhāy.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: A person who is not yet enlightened and takes shelter of a teacher's guidance will ultimately attain spiritual realization. One should focus within and chant the name of Lord Narayana with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Em beṭhā chhe ghaḍī be chār, thayā shukan shubh te vār; <RHYME_20>
Kenī bhujā farakī jamaṇī, kenī farakī ānkhya namṇī.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: In a moment of joy, we should cherish every instant; In the fleeting nature of life, we should count our blessings.

transliteration.couplet:
Kenī farakī chhe pagnī penī, kahe paraspar vāt tenī; <RHYME_21>
Karatā vāt te shukan taṇī, āvī tyā vālānī vadhāmaṇī.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context:
A gentle breeze is a unique companion, shared between two rivers; 
As it flows, the rivers' whispers reveal their secrets to each other.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe ame Gaḍhaḍethī āvyā, sarve munine tiyā teḍāvyā; <RHYME_22>
Evu sant shravaṇe sāmbhaḷī, chālī gāmo-gāmthī manḍaḷī.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a peaceful scene where everyone's thoughts are aligned and the atmosphere is serene, like a symphony. The calmness of the surroundings is contagious, spreading joy and harmony to all who listen and appreciate it.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā sant Prabhujīne pās, āpe ūṭhī maḷyā Avināsh; <RHYME_23>
Ati hete hasīne bolāvyā, kahe Nāth sant bhale āvyā.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: One's life is blessed with divine guidance and eternal peace when one finds the true guru. With a spiritual guide, one can overcome worldly sorrows and find joy in devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Āj kyā thakī āviyā chālī, karo bhikṣhā kahe kar zālī; <RHYME_24>
Sundar rasoī karī chhe sārī, shāk pāk tājā chhe tayārī.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context:
Today's laziness has arrived, and I'm asking for alms; Someone should tell me why this delay is occurring.

The beauty of my situation is well-arranged, the fruit is ripe and ready.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī beṭhī santnī pangati, āpe pīrase ānande ati; <RHYME_25>
Nitya navī rasoyo karāve, jore jore jamāḍī harāve.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context:
In harmony with nature's tranquility, one experiences great joy and delight.
With constant renewal of taste, one's soul is filled with bliss and delight.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati ānandmā Alabelo, diye chhākamchhoḷ chhabīlo; <RHYME_26>
Nā nā karatā bharī diye bhāṇu, e samānī shobhā shu vakhāṇu.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The joy and happiness are overflowing, like the sweetness of sugar; Just as a candle shines brightly in the darkness, so too does our beauty shine forth.

transliteration.couplet:
Shīshe shobhe chhe sonerī renṭo, keḍye kashyo chhe kasumbī fenṭo; <RHYME_27>
Paherī suthaṇī sundar shobhe, joī nāḍī rūḍī man lobhe.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The beauty of golden youth is fleeting and ephemeral, like the color of a rented carpet or the beauty of a lotus flower that withers quickly. Similarly, the sweetness of love is short-lived, as one's mind becomes obsessed with it.

transliteration.couplet:
Gaḷe paheryā gulābnā hār, torā leke ne beke apār; <RHYME_28>
Koṭe shobhe kanaknī māḷā, karamā kanak kaḍā rūpāḷā.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The beauty of a couple's love is beyond compare, like the vast expanse of the sky with countless stars and moon. Their love shines brightly, like gold ornaments on a wedding day.

transliteration.couplet:
Hāthe mudrikā māy chhe maṇi, tenī zagmage jotya ghaṇī; <RHYME_29>
Kare laṭakā ne lāḍavā hāth, jame jan jamāḍe chhe Nāth.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context:
The world is a mere illusion, and our ego is the one that shines brightly; it's the hand of fate that leads us to our true Lord.

Our lives are full of ups and downs like a dance, but ultimately we're in the hands of the Almighty.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī kare alaukik vāt, suṇī sant thāy raḷiyāt; <RHYME_30>
Em vītī gayā dash din, āvyā Boṭādnā harijan.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a peculiar wind that blows away troubles and worries, bringing peace to the mind. After some time passes, even the most difficult problems are resolved like the dawn breaking on the horizon.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvī lāgyā Prabhujīne pāy, ati haraṣhe bharyā man māy; <RHYME_31>
Kahe āvīye amāre gām, Hari pūrīe sahunī hām.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The wife is pleased when her husband returns home from a journey, as she eagerly awaits his arrival and is filled with joy. She invites him to their village, where they will be received with love by Lord Krishna.

transliteration.couplet:
Sarve joī rahyā jan vāṭ, vālā tamārā darshan māṭ; <RHYME_32>
Sarve sant sahit padhāro, harijanne harṣh vadhāro.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context:
All who dwell in this world will have a glimpse of your divine presence; 
All saints gathered together would rejoice and celebrate with joy.

transliteration.couplet:
Sarve karī mūkyo chhe samāj, tamāre pratāpe Mahārāj; <RHYME_33>
Evu suṇī rājī Hari thayā, sāru āvashu ame sahu tiyā.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: The entire society is upside down, like the crown of the great king; In this chaotic state, Lord Krishna's devotees remain calm and tranquil.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Shyāmaḷiyo sajja thaī, chālyā sange sakhā sant laī; <RHYME_34>
Shobhe Shrī Hari ghoḍānī ghaṭe, āvī ūtaryā taḷāv taṭe.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: A bridegroom's preparations are complete, accompanied by friends and sages; He goes to the wedding venue with joy and music.

transliteration.couplet:
Desh-deshnā āvyātā dās, te paṇ ūtariyā ās-pās; <RHYME_35>
Pachhī ūṭhiyā dīndayāḷ, sarve sanghnī levā sambhāḷ.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The foreign land's lordship is fleeting, one should not overstep boundaries and respect the periphery. All connections will be severed if one gets too close to the edge.

transliteration.couplet:
Faryā utāre utāre Nāth, kahe sukhiyā chho sahu sāth; <RHYME_36>
Kāī joīe te mangāvī lejyo, kharachī noya to amane kahejyo.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: A person is happy and content when they have a sense of belonging with their loved ones, as stated by their Lord. One should not be greedy for material wealth, but rather understand the true value of relationships.

transliteration.couplet:
Em pūchhiyu sahu dāsne, pachhī Alabelo āvyā āsane; <RHYME_37>
Gāḍā upar ḍholiyo ḍhāḷī, tiyā poḍhyā pote Vanmāḷī.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context:
I will give a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

When I ask my servant to work hard, he starts to delay; on the roof, there are pots and pans, but the treasure is inside the pot.

transliteration.couplet:
Satasangī ne sarve sant, rahyā rātya bheḷā Bhagwant; <RHYME_38>
Ati ānandmā gaī reṇ, pachhī jāgiyā kamaḷneṇ.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: A true devotee of God is always content and at peace, even in the late hours of night; their soul is filled with immense joy and happiness.

transliteration.couplet:
Tart magāvyo vāji te vār, te par Nāth thayā asavār; <RHYME_39>
Joī sīm ne vāḍī saghaḷī, pachhī nāhīne āviyā vaḷī.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy and unity of a family reunion, where loved ones come together without any disagreements or misunderstandings. The rhyme emphasizes the blissful atmosphere that fills their gathering, with no room for complaints or regrets.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvī gāmmā darshan dīdhā, sarve jan kṛutārath kīdhā; <RHYME_40>
Pachhī sundar karī rasoī, jamyā Nāth janbhāv joī.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a village where every soul is in harmony with nature and God, and one's heart becomes filled with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī jamāḍiyā sarve sant, karī manvārya āpe atyant; <RHYME_41>
Pachhī padhāriyā purbārya, āvyā darshane sahu nar-nārya.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: Behind is the world of saints and peacefulness, while ahead lies chaos;

transliteration.couplet:
Ati ānandmā vītyo dan, karī āratī jamyā jīvan; <RHYME_42>
Pachhī gavaiye gāvaṇu līdhu, gāī jīvat sufaḷ kīdhu.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should experience immense joy and give, as giving brings happiness to oneself and others in life. It implies that when you give, the other person will thank you and your bond will grow stronger.

transliteration.couplet:
Bahu vār dīdhā darashan, pachhī gāmmā āvyā jīvan; <RHYME_43>
Tiyā poḍhiyā prāṇ ādhār, sukh ānande thayu savār.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: A couple's reunion after many years is a joyous sight to behold, as they relive their lives together again. Their love remains strong, rooted in the foundation of their shared experiences and happiness.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī ghoḍe chaḍyā Giridhārī, āvyā sangh māhi sukhkārī; <RHYME_44>
Pachhī sarve jan laī sāth, āvyā gām māhi pote Nāth.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization:

Giridharis' path is followed by all, finding happiness with companions; similarly, I follow the path of my Lord, settling in His village.

transliteration.couplet:
Shaher bajāre sant na māy, ūḍe gulāl Hoḷī ramāy; <RHYME_45>
Vāje ḍhol dadāmā sharaṇāī, jay shabde rahyo nabh chhāī.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: A peaceful saint is found in the desert, amidst the flowers; the joy of life remains even after leaving worldly desires. One's home is where they find comfort and peace, which will remain forever.

transliteration.couplet:
Em range ramyā Hari Hoḷī, sange laī munijan ṭoḷī; <RHYME_46>
Pachhī nāhīne āviyā Nāth, āvyā sarve santjan sāth.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: The devotee's soulful song reaches God's divine ear, accompanied by the rhythm of love; with every step, the Lord's mercy accompanies all souls.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvī karyā Prabhue bhojan, pachhī jamāḍiyā sarve jan; <RHYME_47>
Tyāthī āviyā darabār māy, hato manḍap chotaro tyāy.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: The couplet says that everyone comes to enjoy the feast at God's table, and afterwards all worries disappear; but before that, one should take care of their own mental well-being.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā beṭhā rājā adhirāj, āvyā malla tyā ramavā kāj; <RHYME_48>
Ramī malla ne majaro kīdho, āpī rūpaiyā shirpāv dīdho.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: A king's throne is won by one who can bear the weight of others' troubles, and a wise warrior knows how to conquer his own ego.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī santne teḍāvyā Nāthe, āpyā prasādī modak hāthe; <RHYME_49>
Pachhī santne shīkh ja dīdhī, evī līlā Boṭādmā kīdhī.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The divine's sweet pleasure is available to those who surrender, and He also grants a modak in His hand. One who understands the true nature of life's play can attain it by surrendering to Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Līdho lāvo alaukik jane, Fāgaṇ sudi Pūnyamne dane; <RHYME_50>
Te di utsav karyo Mahārāje, santne sukh āpavā kāje.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: The couplet expresses the joy of being reunited with loved ones after a long time, and the celebration that ensues. It is said to bring happiness and peace to those who are present.

transliteration.couplet:
Somalo Bhakta vaḷī Hamīr, Bhagā Hīrā bhagat sudhīr; <RHYME_51>
Eh ādi harijan jeh, teṇe karāvyo utsav teh.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: A devotee is like a gem that shines brightly when polished by devotion to God. In the same way, the Harijans' (low-caste people) joyous celebrations are amplified by their dedication and faith in God.
